alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:33PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 630 PM MST... At 533 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Palo Verde to 9 miles south of Gila Bend Auxiliary Field. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goodyear, Buckeye, Gila Bend, Tonopah, Estrella, Palo Verde, Big Horn, Cotton Center, Liberty, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Sundad, Wintersburg, Estrella Mountain Ranch, Perryville, Sentinel, Bosque, Painted Rock Dam, Freeman, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field and Sonoran National Monument. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 74 and 120. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 78 and 143. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Buckeye, Avondale; Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County
